Package gchess.boardgame

Class BoardGame<T extends Board>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gchess.boardgame.BoardGame<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - This is the board of the specific game we're using.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChessGame

    public abstract class BoardGame<T extends Board>
extends java.lang.Object

    Board Game

    This class is the core of any implementation of a board game. Examples for games you can create on top of it: Checkers, Chess, Backgammon, Monopoly and so much more.
    Since:
    2018-04-23

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      abstract BoardGame<T> getCopy​()
      This function returns a copy of the current game so that any modifications on the copy won't affect the current game.
      abstract GameState getGameState​()
      This function returns the current game state.
      abstract java.util.Collection<Move> getPossibleMoves​()
      This function returns a collection of the possible (legal) moves of the current alliance.
      abstract void makeMove​(Move move)
      This function executes the move that's given as a parameter and makes changes in the board as needed.
      abstract void undoMove​()
      This function return to the state of the game before the last move.

    • Method Detail

      • getPossibleMoves

        public abstract java.util.Collection<Move> getPossibleMoves​()
        This function returns a collection of the possible (legal) moves of the current alliance.
        Returns:
        Collection of possible moves.

      • getGameState

        public abstract GameState getGameState​()
        This function returns the current game state. e.g: IN_GAME, GAME_ENDED etc.
        Returns:
        The current game state.

      • makeMove

        public abstract void makeMove​(Move move)
        This function executes the move that's given as a parameter and makes changes in the board as needed.
        Parameters:
        move - The move that needs to be executed.

      • undoMove

        public abstract void undoMove​()
        This function return to the state of the game before the last move. Undo twice to go back two states before and so on.

      • getCopy

        public abstract BoardGame<T> getCopy​()
        This function returns a copy of the current game so that any modifications on the copy won't affect the current game.
        Returns:
        A copy of the game.
